page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF ALNE
page.content: { THE VILLAGE OF ALNE Alne is a village in{North Yorkshire.} The nearest city is York. There is one road going through the middle of the village with houses up each side and three roads leading off.Not many new houses have been built. The{houses} that still stand date from the{16th {century}to modern times. There is one shop which is a post office and it sells most things.The church is called St. Mary the Virgin and is a{Norman {church. There is a primary school in the village and there is a{Cheshire {Home}called Alne Hall which is for handicapped people, and another home for retired people. The name Alne came from the Latin word Alnus,an alder tree.It was mentioned in the Domesday Book where it is also spelt as Alne.
